page.title: 14Farming
page.content: Farms in this area are mostly arable. The main crops are wheat and barley for bread, biscuits and animal feed. Since the{British Sugar Corp. closed its{Felsted}factory, sugar beet has been largely replaced by oil seed rape. Peas and beans are used as break crops. At{Gt. Codham Hall}durum wheat is grown for pasta and rye, under contract to{Ryvita,}for crispbread. There are 200 pigs at{Spices Farm, 40 beef cattle at{Codham Hall}and some sheep at{Iron Bridge Farm. At{Boydell's Farm, Roy Threadgold keeps a dairy herd of about 50 {Friesians.}He supplies{Lord Rayleigh's {Dairy}with 450 litres of milk per day from 34 cows. We visited the farm and saw the milking parlour in operation. On a later visit some children tried hand milking. This term some of us were thrilled to see a calf born.
